summary: Email chain from August 13-15, 2019, arranging a visit by U.S. Attorney's Office personnel to the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York to inspect the facility, including the area where Jeffrey Epstein was held, following his death. The visit was to include viewing the psych observation/suicide watch area, the SHU, and Epstein's cordoned-off cell.

events.title: Planned MCC Visit by U.S. Attorney's Office
events.description: A visit scheduled for August 15, 2019, by U.S. Attorney Geoffrey Berman and other DOJ officials to the Metropolitan Correctional Center to inspect the psych observation/suicide watch area, the SHU, and Epstein's cordoned-off cell.

locations: New York Metropolitan Correctional Center, 150 Park Row, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: U.S. Attorney Geoffrey Berman and other DOJ officials planned a visit to the MCC on or around August 15, 2019, following Jeffrey Epstein's death.
The specific purpose was to inspect the 2nd floor psych observation and suicide watch area, the 9th floor SHU, and Epstein's cell, which was still cordoned off.
The request specified that only MCC legal staff should escort them, and they would not speak to any guards due to ongoing investigations.
The email chain shows coordination for the visit, including logistics like entry via the 3rd floor bridge and screening in the front lobby.
